item.title: The Kargil War 1999
item.author: Author
item.description: Pakistani “soldiers” intruded inside India and captured numerous strategically important hills and mountain tops. India deployed their forces to evict them and after a 75 days brutal, bloody, and inspiring war, on 26th July 1999 (Vijay Diwas), India recaptured all its territory.

item.title: A small thing nobody taught you in Python
item.author: Author
item.description:
Have you ever noticed that some stuffs like lower(), upper(), sort() etc. are called like this variable.lower() or variable.sort(). But most of the other function are called like this len(variable), str(variable).
What’s the difference?

item.title: What the heck is defer?
item.author: Author
item.description:
Do you struggle to get the hang of defer too?
Worry not ðŸ˜„, I will try to explain it as simply as I can in this post.

item.title: Addiction to smartphone and its impact on Children
item.author: Author
item.description: Every time there’s a new tool, whether it’s the Internet or cell phones or anything else, all these things can be used for good or evil. Technology is neutral; it depends on how it’s used.

item.title: Does Empowerment Of Girls, Dis-empower The Boys?
item.author: Author
item.description: Feminism isn’t about hating boys. It is about eliminating the gender stereotypes. “A gender-equal society would be one where the word ‘gender’ is not much relevant, where everyone can be themselves.”

item.title: India of the dreams of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel
item.author: Author
item.description: The fact that there is today an India to think, talk and know is very largely due to Sardar Patel’s statesmanship and firm administration. In this modern time of Superheroes and fiction, we too had our own Iron Man in our country. Our very own Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, the man who united our nation.

item.title: Which is more important - Marks or Emotional Stability?
item.author: Author
item.description: All of us wants to get good marks in our exams. Parents push their students to achieve excellence. But is this the only goal in life? What about the emotional stability of today’s students? What about their mental health?
